revised_title: Description and Analysis of a Musical Instrument from the Isle of Amsterdam
tldr: The article describes a unique musical instrument brought from the Isle of Amsterdam in the South Seas by Captain Fourneaux. Joshua Steele, in his letter to Sir John Pringle, provides an account of his experiments with the instrument and explains how it produces various tones and notes. He also discusses the limitations of the instrument in terms of its ability to perform enharmonic intervals.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Ethnomusicology
